text: Khadija Arib, Arabic: خديجة عريب , (born October 10, 1960 in Hedami) is a Dutch politician. She is a member of the Labour Party (PvdA). Arib was born near Casablanca in Morocco. She migrated to the Netherlands when she was 15 years of age. She studied sociology at the University of Amsterdam. She has been a member of the Second Chamber since 1998 (with a short interruption in 2006-2007). She was Speaker of the Second Chamber from 2016 to 2021 (succeeded by Vera Bergkamp). Khadija Arib is married with three children. She is a Muslim and of Moroccan descent. == References == * Bio at Parlement.com Category:1960 births Category:Living people Category:Dutch Muslims Category:Labour Party (Netherlands) politicians Category:Members of the House of Representatives of the Netherlands Category:Moroccan politicians Category:Naturalised citizens of the Netherlands Category:Speakers of the House of Representatives of the Netherlands
title: Khadija Arib
